br.com.estudio89.syncing

Class ReadOnlyAbstractSyncManager<T extends SyncModel<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.com.estudio89.syncing.AbstractSyncManager<T>
      • br.com.estudio89.syncing.ReadOnlyAbstractSyncManager<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SyncManager<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SyncManagerExpiredToken, SyncManagerLogout

    public abstract class ReadOnlyAbstractSyncManager<T extends SyncModel<?>>
extends AbstractSyncManager<T>
    Created by luccascorrea on 11/30/14. A SyncManager that only reads data from the server and never modifies anything.

      • getResponseIdentifier

        public java.lang.String getResponseIdentifier()
        Description copied from interface: SyncManager
        Must return an identifier for the response received after sending the data to the server. This identifier will be used when parsing the server's response so as to identify which data should be passed to this manager.
        Specified by:
        getResponseIdentifier in interface SyncManager<T extends SyncModel<?>>
        Specified by:
        getResponseIdentifier in class AbstractSyncManager<T extends SyncModel<?>>
        Returns:
        the response identifier

      • shouldSendSingleObject

        public boolean shouldSendSingleObject()
        Description copied from interface: SyncManager
        Boolean indicating if the objects must be sent all at once or one by one. It should be true for situations where the object could occupy a large size in the disk and thus sending it one at a time eases the transfer.
        Specified by:
        shouldSendSingleObject in interface SyncManager<T extends SyncModel<?>>
        Specified by:
        shouldSendSingleObject in class AbstractSyncManager<T extends SyncModel<?>>
        Returns:
        true if objects should be sent one by one or false otherwise.

      • getModifiedFiles

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getModifiedFiles()
        Description copied from interface: SyncManager
        Returns a list containing strings that represent the path to files that should be sent to the server. If the model never sends files along with it, this should return an empty list.
        Specified by:
        getModifiedFiles in interface SyncManager<T extends SyncModel<?>>
        Specified by:
        getModifiedFiles in class AbstractSyncManager<T extends SyncModel<?>>
        Returns:
        list of strings with file paths.

      • getModifiedFilesForObject

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getModifiedFilesForObject(org.json.JSONObject object)
        Description copied from interface: SyncManager
        Returns a list containing strings that represent the path of files that should be sent to the server along with a particular object. If objects never send files along with them, this method should return an empty list.
        Specified by:
        getModifiedFilesForObject in interface SyncManager<T extends SyncModel<?>>
        Specified by:
        getModifiedFilesForObject in class AbstractSyncManager<T extends SyncModel<?>>
        Parameters:
        object - json object whose files must be listed.
        Returns:
        list of strings with file paths.

      • postEvent

        public void postEvent(java.util.List<T> objects,
                      AsyncBus bus,
                      android.content.Context context)
        Description copied from interface: SyncManager
        This method posts an event indicating that new data were saved by this manager. It is necessary to create a public static class that implements SyncEvent defining this manager's events. When a class needs to subscribe to this event, it is necessary to create a method with the annotation Subscribe that should receive a single parameter that is an instance of the event class.
        Specified by:
        postEvent in interface SyncManager<T extends SyncModel<?>>
        Specified by:
        postEvent in class AbstractSyncManager<T extends SyncModel<?>>
        Parameters:
        objects - objects to be sent along with the event
        bus - Bus that must be used when posting the event.

      • processSendResponse

        public java.util.List<T> processSendResponse(org.json.JSONArray jsonArray)
        Description copied from interface: SyncManager
        This method is responsible for processing the response received after sending the data to the server. This method is called after sending data even if the server did not send a response specifically to this manager. Therefore if for your particular manager, the server never sends a response and an empty response is meaningless, this method can return an empty list.
        Specified by:
        processSendResponse in interface SyncManager<T extends SyncModel<?>>
        Overrides:
        processSendResponse in class AbstractSyncManager<T extends SyncModel<?>>
        Parameters:
        jsonArray - the response sent by the server
        Returns:
        a list of items that were updated.
